Sentencas: A thermal transport model has been developed for analyzing heat transfer and improving thermal management within tubular solid oxide fuel cells (TSOFCs).
Titulo: Characterizing heat transfer within a commercial-grade tubular solid oxide fuel cell for enhanced thermal management

Sentencas: The model was constructed via a proven electrochemical model and well-established heat transfer correlations.
Titulo: Characterizing heat transfer within a commercial-grade tubular solid oxide fuel cell for enhanced thermal management

Sentencas: Its predictions compare favorably with other published data.
Titulo: Characterizing heat transfer within a commercial-grade tubular solid oxide fuel cell for enhanced thermal management

Sentencas: Air temperatures consistently approach that of the fuel cell.
Titulo: Characterizing heat transfer within a commercial-grade tubular solid oxide fuel cell for enhanced thermal management

Sentencas: This is primarily due to the high operating temperature of the cell (1000 degreesC), the moderate magnitudes of radiation and airflow, and cell geometry.
Titulo: Characterizing heat transfer within a commercial-grade tubular solid oxide fuel cell for enhanced thermal management

Sentencas: The required inlet air temperature (for thermally steady-state operation) has linear dependence on operating voltage and fuel utilization.
Titulo: Characterizing heat transfer within a commercial-grade tubular solid oxide fuel cell for enhanced thermal management

Sentencas: Inlet air temperature has an inverse proportionality with respect to air stoichiometric number (i.e., inverse equivalence ratio).
Titulo: Characterizing heat transfer within a commercial-grade tubular solid oxide fuel cell for enhanced thermal management

Sentencas: The current standard for airflow within TSOFCs was found to be excessive in consideration of the regenerative preheat effect within the supply pipes that feed air to the cell.
Titulo: Characterizing heat transfer within a commercial-grade tubular solid oxide fuel cell for enhanced thermal management

Sentencas: Thermal management of simple TSOFC systems could be enhanced if commonly used air stoichiometric numbers were decreased.
Titulo: Characterizing heat transfer within a commercial-grade tubular solid oxide fuel cell for enhanced thermal management
Characterizing heat transfer within a commercial-grade tubular solid oxide fuel cell for enhanced thermal management
